Interface FormattedNamedFunction<T,R>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the input of the function
R - the type of the output of the function
All Superinterfaces:
FormattedFunction<T,R>, Function<T,R>, NamedFunction<T,R>
public interface FormattedNamedFunction<T,R> extends NamedFunction<T,R>, FormattedFunction<T,R>
A function with a name which can format its output according to a format. This function works like Function, but provides a name in the form of a String and a format in the form of a String that follows the format string syntax used by PrintStream.printf(String, Object...).

  • Field Summary

    • from

      static <T, R> FormattedNamedFunction<T,R> from(Function<T,R> f)
      Builds a named and formatted function given a function, possibly with the default name and format. If the input function f is a FormattedNamedFunction, , simply returns f; otherwise, calls from(Function, String, String) retaining the name (if f is a NamedFunction) or the format (if f is a FormattedFunction).
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the input of the function
      R - the type of the output of the function
      Parameters:
      f - the function
      Returns:
      the formatted and named function

    • compose

      default <V> FormattedNamedFunction<V,R> compose(Function<? super V,? extends T> before)
      Returns a composed formatted and named function that first applies the before function to its input, and then applies this named function to the result. The format of the returned formatted function is the same of this function.
      Specified by:
      compose in interface FormattedFunction<T,R>
      Specified by:

      Specified by:
      compose in interface NamedFunction<T,R>
      Type Parameters:
      V - the type of input of the before function, and of the composed function
      Parameters:
      before - the function to apply before this function is applied
      Returns:
      the composed formatted and named function

    • andThen

      default <V> FormattedNamedFunction<T,V> andThen(Function<? super R,? extends V> after)
      Returns a composed formatted and named function that first applies this formatted function to its input, and then applies the after function to the result. If the after function is a formatted function, the format of the returned function is the one of after; otherwise, it is the default format FormattedFunction.UNFORMATTED_FORMAT. If the after function is a named function, the name of the returned function is a composition of the two names, through NamedFunction.composeNames(String...).
      Specified by:
      andThen in interface FormattedFunction<T,R>
      Specified by:
      andThen in interface Function<T,R>
      Specified by:
      andThen in interface NamedFunction<T,R>
      Type Parameters:
      V - the type of output of the after function, and of the composed function
      Parameters:
      after - the function to apply after this function is applied
      Returns:
      the composed formatted and named function
